p: This article has described the package incidence and its featuresâ€”which include three lightweight data classes and utilities for data manipulation, plotting, and modeling. We have shown that an incidence object can flexibly be defined at different datetime intervals with any number of stratifications and be subset by groups or dates. The most important aspects of this package are use-ability and interoperability. For both field epidemiologists and academic modellers, the data received are often in the form of line-lists where each row represents a single case. We have shown that these data can easily be converted to an incidence object and then plotted with sensible defaults in two lines of code.
